page.title: 12THE NEW CHURCH.
page.content: The church is in the centre of Burnfoot at the top of Fraser Avenue. It is a replacement of the old hut church in Fairhurst Drive. The new church was built in l955. It has the usual things like pulpit, communion table, lecturn and baptismal font. To the left of the lecturn is the door to the vestry where the minister changes into his robes and cassock. Because of the movable chairs it is not only used as a church but as a theatre and badminton hall. The modern church is used throughout the week. As well as its normal use there are bible classes, Girls Brigade. Sunday School, play school and services. The modern church gets more use than the old one did.
